title: Configure a valid Blackrays deployment slug and ensure live SPA routing

requirements.summary: Choose a valid platform deployment slug containing "blackrays" and store it in frontend configuration for consistent use during deployment.
acceptanceCriteria: A domain/slug is configured that contains "blackrays" and matches the pattern ^[a-z0-9-]{5,50}$ (case-insensitive).
The configured domain/slug is different from "blackrays-car-rentals-&-tours-and-travels" and contains no characters outside letters, numbers, and hyphens.

file_operations.description: Add a single source of truth for the chosen deployment slug (e.g., "blackrays-car-rentals-tours-travels") plus a small validator matching ^[a-z0-9-]{5,50}$ to prevent reintroducing invalid characters.

Document the selected valid slug, explicitly note that "blackrays-car-rentals-&-tours-and-travels" must not be used, and outline how to apply the slug during platform-managed deployment (no external DNS).

requirements.summary: Ensure the deployed SPA reliably serves and renders primary navigation routes on a live static deployment.
acceptanceCriteria: The site loads successfully at the configured live URL (home page renders without a blank screen).
Primary navigation routes (/about, /packages, /car-rentals, /contact) are accessible on the live deployment.

file_operations.description: Add an SPA fallback page that loads the same app entry as the main HTML so direct navigation to /about, /packages, /car-rentals, and /contact works on common static hosts that serve 404.html for unknown paths.
Add a static-host redirect rule to serve the app shell for all paths (for hosts that support _redirects), enabling deep links to render the correct route after deployment.

Switch internal navigation in the footer quick links from hard <a href> navigations to TanStack Router links to keep route transitions within the SPA and avoid unnecessary full page reloads after deployment.
